data.text:
Since I’ve been asked a lot:

Buy stock in several companies that make products & services that *you* believe in.

Only sell if you think their products & services are trending worse. Don’t panic when the market does.

This will serve you well in the long-term.

data.text:
@pegobry @pmarca Exactly. Right before he died, Jack Bogle (of Vanguard fame) said index/passive funds were too great a percentage of the market and he really knew what he was talking about! 

There should be a shift back towards active investment. Passive has gone too far.

tweets.text:
@pmarca don’t forget proxy advisory firms (ISS, glass lewis), that de facto control the vote of the largest passive investment managers

ISS’s recommendation often the deciding factor in who wins a proxy fight

@elonmusk @pmarca Deeper problem: according to Modern Portfolio Theory, the most rational investment strategy is to buy the market. But the reason why the market reflects the fundamentals of companies is because arbitrageurs (active investors) make it so. So what happens when everyone is passive?

Human tendency to conform, especially when in large groups, is terrifying. Propaganda machines leverage this throughout human history.

The way out is to think freely, detached from the divisive narratives of the day that masquerade as universal truths.

This often feels lonely.

urls.title: GlaxoSmithKline to Plead Guilty and Pay $3 Billion to Resolve Fraud
urls.description: Global health care giant GlaxoSmithKline LLC (GSK) agreed to plead guilty and to pay $3 billion to resolve its criminal and civil liability arising from the company’s unlawful promotion of

tweets.text:

Using a modern 80-year lifetime as a unit, only 150 lifetimes ago, the Americas were untouched by people. The first human set foot in Europe only 500 lifetimes ago. 1,200 lifetimes ago we only lived in Africa. Humans are so new.

[image: https://t.co/AtuQqqnT9R] https://t.co/fdUWCAzNbA

Everything we call civilization was invented in the last 500 generations—way too short a time for our bodies and brains to re-optimize. We're a bunch of primates in a totally unnatural environment, trying our best. Good thing to keep in mind! https://t.co/bkKCOFlI1Q
